National Day Holiday

October 1st is China's National Holiday, celebrating the founding of the People's Republic of China on October 1st, 1949. It seems to be a bigger deal then the 4th of July is in the US. In the US, we don't usually get the day off work, but here in China, we get the entire week off. I'm going to use my week off to do some travelling.

I'm travelling with a group of other foreign teachers--about 10 of us total, I believe. We're going to Changbai Shan (which you can read about here, here and here), a mountain range that seperates China from North Korea. We're also planning to visit the city of Dalian.

We leave Saturday morning. This'll probably be my last blog post for a while since I'll be travelling.

About

Well, I'm back in Qinhuangdao from Hong Kong and Taiwan. My time in Hong Kong and Taiwan was enjoyable, but not very eventful. I've got more about my time in China that I plan to blog about, but recently I've focused all my computer time on finishing a project that I'll be putting on my resume for when I apply for jobs. So blogging just isn't a priority right now.

The Olympics don't officially start until tomorrow night, but some of the events have already began. I went to the USA vs. Norway women's soccer game last night. Unfortunately, we lost 2-0, but it was fun to go. I'll be going to 3 different events in Beijing before flying home in 6 days!
